trans-unit.source: Data Factory - Release Notes | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Data Factory - Release Notes | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Notes for 07/17/2015 release of Data Factory
trans-unit.target: Notes for 07/17/2015 release of Data Factory

trans-unit.source: The following JSON changes are introduced in the July 2015 release of Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: The following JSON changes are introduced in the July 2015 release of Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Update to types of linked services, tables, and activities
trans-unit.target: Update to types of linked services, tables, and activities

trans-unit.source: The new **typeProperties** element contains type specific properties for a linked service/table/activity.
trans-unit.target: The new **typeProperties** element contains type specific properties for a linked service/table/activity.

trans-unit.source: The **type** property is moved one level up and is set to **AzureStorage** (change from **AzureStorageLinkedService** to **AzureStorage**)
trans-unit.target: The **type** property is moved one level up and is set to **AzureStorage** (change from **AzureStorageLinkedService** to **AzureStorage**)

trans-unit.source: New **typeProperties** element that contains properties supported by the Azure Storage linked service (**connectionString** in this example).
trans-unit.target: New **typeProperties** element that contains properties supported by the Azure Storage linked service (**connectionString** in this example).

trans-unit.source: The **type** property is moved one level up and the type name **AzureTableLocation** has been changed to **AzureTable**.
trans-unit.target: The **type** property is moved one level up and the type name **AzureTableLocation** has been changed to **AzureTable**.

trans-unit.source: The **linkedServiceName** is moved one level up.
trans-unit.target: The **linkedServiceName** is moved one level up.

trans-unit.source: The **location** element is removed now and the type specific properties such as **tableName** that were specified in the **location** section are specified in the new **typeProperties** section.
trans-unit.target: The **location** element is removed now and the type specific properties such as **tableName** that were specified in the **location** section are specified in the new **typeProperties** section.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the **transformation** element has been replaced with the new **typeProperties** element.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the **transformation** element has been replaced with the new **typeProperties** element.

trans-unit.source: The **waitOnExternal** element is replaced with the new **external** and **externalData** properties.
trans-unit.target: The **waitOnExternal** element is replaced with the new **external** and **externalData** properties.

trans-unit.source: The **waitOnExternal** property is removed from the **availability** section
trans-unit.target: The **waitOnExternal** property is removed from the **availability** section

trans-unit.source: A new **external** property is added one level up and is set to **true** for an external table.
trans-unit.target: A new **external** property is added one level up and is set to **true** for an external table.

trans-unit.source: The properties of **waitOnExternal** element such as **retryInterval** are added to the new **externalData** section in the **Policy** element.
trans-unit.target: The properties of **waitOnExternal** element such as **retryInterval** are added to the new **externalData** section in the **Policy** element.

trans-unit.source: The **externalData** element is an optional element.
trans-unit.target: The **externalData** element is an optional element.

trans-unit.source: When you use the **externalData** element, you must have the **external** property set to **true**.
trans-unit.target: When you use the **externalData** element, you must have the **external** property set to **true**.

trans-unit.source: New copyBehavior property for the BlobSink
trans-unit.target: New copyBehavior property for the BlobSink

trans-unit.source: This property defines the copy behavior when the source is **BlobSource** or **FileSystem**.
trans-unit.target: This property defines the copy behavior when the source is **BlobSource** or **FileSystem**.

trans-unit.source: There are three possible values for the **copyBehavior** property.
trans-unit.target: There are three possible values for the **copyBehavior** property.

trans-unit.source: **PreserveHierarchy**:: preserves the file hierarchy in the target folder, i.e., the relative path of source file to source folder is identical to the relative path of target file to target folder.
trans-unit.target: **PreserveHierarchy**:: preserves the file hierarchy in the target folder, i.e., the relative path of source file to source folder is identical to the relative path of target file to target folder.

trans-unit.source: **FlattenHierarchy**: : all files from the source folder will be in the first level of target folder.
trans-unit.target: **FlattenHierarchy**: : all files from the source folder will be in the first level of target folder.

trans-unit.source: The target files will have auto generated name.
trans-unit.target: The target files will have auto generated name.

trans-unit.source: **MergeFiles**: merges all files from the source folder to one file.
trans-unit.target: **MergeFiles**: merges all files from the source folder to one file.

trans-unit.source: If the File/Blob Name is specified, the merged file name would be the specified name; otherwise, would be auto-generated file name.
trans-unit.target: If the File/Blob Name is specified, the merged file name would be the specified name; otherwise, would be auto-generated file name.

trans-unit.source: New getDebugInfo property for all HDInsight activities
trans-unit.target: New getDebugInfo property for all HDInsight activities

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight activities (Hive, Pig, MapReduce, Hadoop Streaming) support the new property: **getDebugInfo** property.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight activities (Hive, Pig, MapReduce, Hadoop Streaming) support the new property: **getDebugInfo** property.

trans-unit.source: The **getDebugInfo** property is an optional element.
trans-unit.target: The **getDebugInfo** property is an optional element.

trans-unit.source: When it is set to **Failure**, the logs are downloaded only on execution failure.
trans-unit.target: When it is set to **Failure**, the logs are downloaded only on execution failure.

trans-unit.source: When it is set to **All**, logs are always downloaded irrespective of the execution status.
trans-unit.target: When it is set to **All**, logs are always downloaded irrespective of the execution status.

trans-unit.source: When it is set to **None**, no logs are downloaded.
trans-unit.target: When it is set to **None**, no logs are downloaded.

trans-unit.source: Notes for 04/10/2015 release of Data Factory
trans-unit.target: Notes for 04/10/2015 release of Data Factory

trans-unit.source: You will see the **Recently updated slices** and **Recently failed slices** lists on the **TABLE** blade now.
trans-unit.target: You will see the **Recently updated slices** and **Recently failed slices** lists on the **TABLE** blade now.

trans-unit.source: These lists are sorted by the update time of the slice.
trans-unit.target: These lists are sorted by the update time of the slice.

trans-unit.source: The update time of a slice is changed in the following situations.
trans-unit.target: The update time of a slice is changed in the following situations.

trans-unit.source: You update the status of the slice manually, for example, by using the **Set-AzureDataFactorySliceStatus** (or) by clicking **RUN** on the **SLICE** blade for the slice.
trans-unit.target: You update the status of the slice manually, for example, by using the **Set-AzureDataFactorySliceStatus** (or) by clicking **RUN** on the **SLICE** blade for the slice.

trans-unit.source: The slice changes status due to an execution (e.g. a run started, a run ended and failed, a run ended and succeeded, etc).
trans-unit.target: The slice changes status due to an execution (e.g. a run started, a run ended and failed, a run ended and succeeded, etc).

trans-unit.source: Click on the title of the lists or **... (ellipses)** to see the larger list of slices.
trans-unit.target: Click on the title of the lists or **... (ellipses)** to see the larger list of slices.

trans-unit.source: Click **Filter** on the toolbar to filter the slices.
trans-unit.target: Click **Filter** on the toolbar to filter the slices.

trans-unit.source: You can still view slices sorted by the slice times by clicking **Data slices (by slice time)** tile.
trans-unit.target: You can still view slices sorted by the slice times by clicking **Data slices (by slice time)** tile.

trans-unit.source: The slices in those collections are ordered by slice time.
trans-unit.target: The slices in those collections are ordered by slice time.

trans-unit.source: For example, if it’s an hourly schedule, the slices would be:
trans-unit.target: For example, if it’s an hourly schedule, the slices would be:

trans-unit.source: But, if an older slice is re-run, it would not show up on the top of this list, even though that’s probably what the user is more interested in.
trans-unit.target: But, if an older slice is re-run, it would not show up on the top of this list, even though that’s probably what the user is more interested in.

trans-unit.source: Notes for 3/31/2015 release of Data Factory
trans-unit.target: Notes for 3/31/2015 release of Data Factory

trans-unit.source: Updated **Data Management Gateway** installation package has been posted to [Microsoft Download Center][adf-gateway-download].
trans-unit.target: Updated **Data Management Gateway** installation package has been posted to [Microsoft Download Center][adf-gateway-download].

trans-unit.source: Copying from **on-premises file system to Azure blob** is supported now.
trans-unit.target: Copying from **on-premises file system to Azure blob** is supported now.

trans-unit.source: See the following topics for more information.
trans-unit.target: See the following topics for more information.

trans-unit.source: OnPremisesFileSystemLocation properties in a table JSON
trans-unit.target: OnPremisesFileSystemLocation properties in a table JSON

trans-unit.source: See the updated copy matrix and **FileSystemSource** properties.
trans-unit.target: See the updated copy matrix and **FileSystemSource** properties.

trans-unit.source: Copying from **on-premises Oracle database to Azure blob** is supported now.
trans-unit.target: Copying from **on-premises Oracle database to Azure blob** is supported now.

trans-unit.source: See the following topics for more informaiton.
trans-unit.target: See the following topics for more informaiton.

trans-unit.source: OnPremisesOracleTableLocation properties in a table JSON
trans-unit.target: OnPremisesOracleTableLocation properties in a table JSON

trans-unit.source: See the updated copy matrix and **OracleSource** properties.
trans-unit.target: See the updated copy matrix and **OracleSource** properties.

trans-unit.source: You can specify encoding for text files in an Azure Blob.
trans-unit.target: You can specify encoding for text files in an Azure Blob.

trans-unit.source: You can invoke a stored procedure with additional parameters when copying into SQL Sink.
trans-unit.target: You can invoke a stored procedure with additional parameters when copying into SQL Sink.

trans-unit.source: See the blob post: [Azure Data Factory Update - New Data Stores](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2015/03/30/azure-data-factory-update-new-data-stores/) for additional information including examples.
trans-unit.target: See the blob post: [Azure Data Factory Update - New Data Stores](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2015/03/30/azure-data-factory-update-new-data-stores/) for additional information including examples.

trans-unit.source: Notes for 2/27/2015 release of Data Factory
trans-unit.target: Notes for 2/27/2015 release of Data Factory

trans-unit.source: The Data Factory Editor, which is part of the Azure Preview Portal, allows you to create, edit, and deploy JSON files that define linked services, data sets, and pipelines.The main goal of the editor is to provide you a fast and light-weight user-interface (UI) to create Azure Data Factory artifacts without requiring you to install Azure PowerShell and ramp up on using PowerShell cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: The Data Factory Editor, which is part of the Azure Preview Portal, allows you to create, edit, and deploy JSON files that define linked services, data sets, and pipelines.The main goal of the editor is to provide you a fast and light-weight user-interface (UI) to create Azure Data Factory artifacts without requiring you to install Azure PowerShell and ramp up on using PowerShell cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: See the [Azure Data Factory Editor - A Light Weight Web Editor][adf-editor-blog] blog post for a quick overview and a video on Data Factory Editor.
trans-unit.target: See the [Azure Data Factory Editor - A Light Weight Web Editor][adf-editor-blog] blog post for a quick overview and a video on Data Factory Editor.

trans-unit.source: For detailed overview of the editor, see the [Data Factory Editor][adf-editor] article.
trans-unit.target: For detailed overview of the editor, see the [Data Factory Editor][adf-editor] article.

trans-unit.source: Notes for 1/26/2015 release of Data Factory
trans-unit.target: Notes for 1/26/2015 release of Data Factory

trans-unit.source: Updated **Data Management Gateway** installation package has been posted to [Microsoft Download Center][adf-gateway-download].
trans-unit.target: Updated **Data Management Gateway** installation package has been posted to [Microsoft Download Center][adf-gateway-download].

trans-unit.source: Starting from this release, you can find the latest Data Management Gateway to use with Azure Data Factory at this download location.
trans-unit.target: Starting from this release, you can find the latest Data Management Gateway to use with Azure Data Factory at this download location.

trans-unit.source: This installation package serves both Azure Data Factory and Power BI for Office 365 services.
trans-unit.target: This installation package serves both Azure Data Factory and Power BI for Office 365 services.

trans-unit.source: If you are using both the services, note that gateways for Data Factory and Power BI must be installed on different machines, and configured differently as per guidance from the Data Factory or Power BI documentation.
trans-unit.target: If you are using both the services, note that gateways for Data Factory and Power BI must be installed on different machines, and configured differently as per guidance from the Data Factory or Power BI documentation.

trans-unit.source: The **Copy Activity** now supports copying data between on-premises SQL Server database and an Azure SQL database.
trans-unit.target: The **Copy Activity** now supports copying data between on-premises SQL Server database and an Azure SQL database.

trans-unit.source: This property gives you the flexibility to configure how long to wait for the batch insert operation to complete before the operation times out.
trans-unit.target: This property gives you the flexibility to configure how long to wait for the batch insert operation to complete before the operation times out.

trans-unit.source: For a hybrid copy (copy operation that involves an on-premises data source and a cloud data source), you must have the gateway of version 1.4 or higher to use this property.
trans-unit.target: For a hybrid copy (copy operation that involves an on-premises data source and a cloud data source), you must have the gateway of version 1.4 or higher to use this property.

trans-unit.source: **SQL Server linked service** now supports **Windows Authentication**.
trans-unit.target: **SQL Server linked service** now supports **Windows Authentication**.

trans-unit.source: When creating a SQL Server linked service using the portal, you can now choose to use Windows Authentication and set appropriate credentials.
trans-unit.target: When creating a SQL Server linked service using the portal, you can now choose to use Windows Authentication and set appropriate credentials.

trans-unit.source: This requires you to have the gateway of version 1.4 or higher.
trans-unit.target: This requires you to have the gateway of version 1.4 or higher.

trans-unit.source: When creating a SQL Server linked service using Azure PowerShell, you can specify connection information in plain text or encrypt the connection information using updated [New-AzureDataFactoryEncryptValue cmdlet][adf-encrypt-value-cmdlet] and then use the encrypted string for the Connection String property in the linked service JSON payload.
trans-unit.target: When creating a SQL Server linked service using Azure PowerShell, you can specify connection information in plain text or encrypt the connection information using updated [New-AzureDataFactoryEncryptValue cmdlet][adf-encrypt-value-cmdlet] and then use the encrypted string for the Connection String property in the linked service JSON payload.

trans-unit.source: See [Linked Services][adf-msdn-linked-services] for details about defining a linked service in JSON.
trans-unit.target: See [Linked Services][adf-msdn-linked-services] for details about defining a linked service in JSON.

trans-unit.source: The encryption feature is not supported by the New-AzureDataFactoryEncryptValue cmdlet yet.
trans-unit.target: The encryption feature is not supported by the New-AzureDataFactoryEncryptValue cmdlet yet.

trans-unit.source: Notes for 12/11/2014 release of Data Factory
trans-unit.target: Notes for 12/11/2014 release of Data Factory

trans-unit.source: This release of Azure Data Factory service allows you to integrate Azure Data Factory with Azure Machine Learning (ML) by using **AzureMLLinkedService** and **AzureMLBatchScoringActivity**.
trans-unit.target: This release of Azure Data Factory service allows you to integrate Azure Data Factory with Azure Machine Learning (ML) by using **AzureMLLinkedService** and **AzureMLBatchScoringActivity**.

trans-unit.source: See [Create predictive pipelines using Data Factory and Azure Machine Learning][adf-azure-ml] for details.
trans-unit.target: See [Create predictive pipelines using Data Factory and Azure Machine Learning][adf-azure-ml] for details.

trans-unit.source: "NewVersionAvailable" status will be shown in the Azure Preview Portal and in the output of Get-AzureDataFactoryGateway cmdlet, if there is a newer version of the gateway available than the one that is currently installed.
trans-unit.target: "NewVersionAvailable" status will be shown in the Azure Preview Portal and in the output of Get-AzureDataFactoryGateway cmdlet, if there is a newer version of the gateway available than the one that is currently installed.

trans-unit.source: You can then follow the portal journey to download the new installation file (.msi) and run it to install the latest gateway.
trans-unit.target: You can then follow the portal journey to download the new installation file (.msi) and run it to install the latest gateway.

trans-unit.source: There is no additional configuration is needed.
trans-unit.target: There is no additional configuration is needed.

trans-unit.source: In the JSON definition for a HDInsightOnDemandLinkedService, you do not need to specify **jobsContainer** property anymore.
trans-unit.target: In the JSON definition for a HDInsightOnDemandLinkedService, you do not need to specify **jobsContainer** property anymore.

trans-unit.source: If you have the property specified for an on-demand linked service, the property is ignored.
trans-unit.target: If you have the property specified for an on-demand linked service, the property is ignored.

trans-unit.source: You can remove the property from the JSON definition for the linked service and update the linked service definition by using New-AzureDataFactoryLinkedService cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: You can remove the property from the JSON definition for the linked service and update the linked service definition by using New-AzureDataFactoryLinkedService cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: This release introduces support for a few optional configuration parameters for HDInsightOnDemandLinked (on-demand HDInsight cluster).
trans-unit.target: This release introduces support for a few optional configuration parameters for HDInsightOnDemandLinked (on-demand HDInsight cluster).

trans-unit.source: When creating an Azure Data Factory gateway via portal or PowerShell (New-AzureDataFactoryGateway), you no longer need to specifiy the location for the gateway.
trans-unit.target: When creating an Azure Data Factory gateway via portal or PowerShell (New-AzureDataFactoryGateway), you no longer need to specifiy the location for the gateway.

trans-unit.source: The data factory region will be inherited.
trans-unit.target: The data factory region will be inherited.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, to configure a SQL Server linked Service using JSON, "gatewayLocation" property is not needed anymore.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, to configure a SQL Server linked Service using JSON, "gatewayLocation" property is not needed anymore.

trans-unit.source: Data Factory .NET SDK is also updated to refelct these changes.
trans-unit.target: Data Factory .NET SDK is also updated to refelct these changes.

trans-unit.source: If you use an older version of SDK and Azure PowerShell, you are still required to provide the location setting.
trans-unit.target: If you use an older version of SDK and Azure PowerShell, you are still required to provide the location setting.

trans-unit.source: You will need to update Data Factory NuGet packages and change ICustomActivity to IDotNetActivity in the source code for your custom activity.
trans-unit.target: You will need to update Data Factory NuGet packages and change ICustomActivity to IDotNetActivity in the source code for your custom activity.

trans-unit.source: The type of custom activity in the JSON definition for you custom activity must be changed from **CustomActivity** to **DotNetActivity**.
trans-unit.target: The type of custom activity in the JSON definition for you custom activity must be changed from **CustomActivity** to **DotNetActivity**.

trans-unit.source: The **CustomActivity** and **CustomActivityProperties** classes have been renamed to **DotNetActivity** and **DotNetActivityProperties** with the same set of properties.
trans-unit.target: The **CustomActivity** and **CustomActivityProperties** classes have been renamed to **DotNetActivity** and **DotNetActivityProperties** with the same set of properties.

trans-unit.source: If you use the older verion of SDK and Azure PowerShell, you can continue using CustomActivity instead of DotNetActivity.
trans-unit.target: If you use the older verion of SDK and Azure PowerShell, you can continue using CustomActivity instead of DotNetActivity.

trans-unit.source: See [Use custom activities in an Azure Data Factory pipeline][adf-custom-activities] for a walkthrough on how to create a custom activity and use it in an Azure Data Factory pipeline.
trans-unit.target: See [Use custom activities in an Azure Data Factory pipeline][adf-custom-activities] for a walkthrough on how to create a custom activity and use it in an Azure Data Factory pipeline.
